title: Cat. 42  Tea and Coffee Set, 1809/12
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Jean-Simon Chaudron (American, born France, 1758–1846)  
Anthony Rasch (American, born Germany, c. 1780–1858)  
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania  
Silver and ebonized wood; coffeepot: 27.9 × 30.5 × 15.2 cm (11 3/4 × 12 × 6 1/2 in.); teapot: 25.4 × 30.5 × 12.7 cm (10 1/8 × 12 × 5 7/8 in.); cream pot: 17.8 × 15.2 × 10.2 cm (7 1/4 × 6 1/4 × 4 in.); sugar bowl: 22.9 × 22.9 × 12.7 cm (9 × 9 × 5 1/4 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, Robert Allerton Endowment, 1989.156.1–4

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On bottom of each object (fig. 42.1)

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">With Firestone and Parson, Boston, by 1989.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1989.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Schwartz (1990), p. 77 (ill.).

Barter et al. (1998), pp. 134–36, cat. 55 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Tea and Coffee Set, 1809/12.

fig. 42.1 </section>
